name: Readers and Writers System
author: Tim Quatmann <tim.quatmann@cs.rwth-aachen.de>
description: GSPN Model of a readers and writers system based on the GSPN of [0], Figure 5.3. `KÂ´ processes want to access a common resource either for reading of for writing. While writing requires exclusive access to the resource, reading can be done simultaneously. Each read or write access is followed by a network transfer phase. After completing the resource access, a process requests a new access either immediately or after an exponentially distributed delay.

properties.name: pr_many_requests
properties.description: The maximal probability that at some point more than 80% of the processes request either the resource or the network.

properties.name: exp_time_many_requests
properties.description: The minimal expected time until more than 80% of the processes request either the resource or the network.

properties.name: pr_network
properties.description: The maximal probability that more processes request the network than the resource when first reaching a state where more than 80% of the processes are requesting.

properties.name: prtb_many_requests
properties.description: The maximal probability that within 5 time units more than 80% of the processes request either the resource or the network.

conversion.command: storm-gspn --gspnfile readers-writers.pnpro --to-jani readers-writers.5.jani --prop readers-writers.csl --capacitiesfile readers-writers.capacities --constants K=5 --standard-compliant
storm-gspn --gspnfile readers-writers.pnpro --to-jani readers-writers.20.jani --prop readers-writers.csl --capacitiesfile readers-writers.capacities --constants K=20 --standard-compliant
storm-gspn --gspnfile readers-writers.pnpro --to-jani readers-writers.35.jani --prop readers-writers.csl --capacitiesfile readers-writers.capacities --constants K=35 --standard-compliant
storm-gspn --gspnfile readers-writers.pnpro --to-jani readers-writers.40.jani --prop readers-writers.csl --capacitiesfile readers-writers.capacities --constants K=40 --standard-compliant
